intro: Phanera glabrifolia var. glabrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leaved phanera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
